results.title: Accident
results.brief_description: An Oxford undergraduate is killed in a car crash; his tutor looks back over the tangle of personal relationships that contributed to his death. This screenplay by Harold Pinter, based on the novel by Nicholas Mosley, is a fascinating, if uneven, study of a teacher who becomes involved with his student. Cast includes Dirk Bogarde, Stanley Baker, Michael York and Jacqueline Sassard.

results.title: The Servant
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey, Norman Priggen and Springbok Films
results.brief_description: A socio-psychological drama in which a servant, Barratt, is hired by an upper-class, self-centred young man, who has moved into a new house at Chelsea where he plans to live with his fiancee after their marriage. Gradually the relationship of servant and master changes as the latter finds himself slowly falling under Barratt’s control Harold Pinter’s superb study of brooding hatred and hypocrisy within the ever-shifting borders of the class struggle is based on the novel ‘The Servant’ by Robin Maugham. Music by John Dankworth. Cast: Dirk Bogarde, Sarah Miles, Wendy Craig, James Fox.

results.title: The Go-between
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey, John Heyman, Norman Priggen, Robert Velaise, EMI/Parlophone and World Film Services
results.brief_description: Based on L.P. Hartley’s classic Edwardian novel. The screenplay written by Harold Pinter is the story of lost love, youth and innocence. Spending a long hot summer at a Norfolk stately home, a young boy becomes the misunderstood carrier of love letters between an aristocratic lady and a local farmer - a forbidden romance ending in heartbreak and tragedy for all. Cast includes Julie Christie, Dominic Guard, Margaret Leighton, Michael Redgrave, Michael Gough, Edward Fox and Alan Bates.

results.title: The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Brian Kavanagh, Fred Schepisi and The Film House
results.brief_description: Based on the Thomas Keneally novel, this is the fictionalised story of Jimmy Governor, who, in 1901 went on a rampage killing numerous white settlers. Deft characterisation and ironic detail combine to paint a bleak portrait of a bitterly racist society emerging as a federated nation. Starring Tommy Lewis in the title role with co-stars Ray Barrett and Jack Thompson.

results.title: Weekend of Shadows
results.creator_credit: Tom Jeffrey, Matt Carroll and Samson Productions
results.brief_description: A small country town in the thirties. A farmer’s wife is murdered and suspicion immediately falls on a Polish labourer who has disappeared. The local policeman forms a posse to search for the missing man. Tension mount amongst the members of the posse, all of whom have a past secret to hide or live down. Cast includes John Waters. Photography: Richard Wallace ; writer, Peter Yeldham.

results.title: Cathy's Child
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Errol Sullivan and Pam Oliver
results.brief_description: In 1973, Cathy Baikas, a Maltese immigrant, contacted “The Sun” newspaper office in Sydney to seek help. Cathy’s Greek-born husband, from whom she was separated, had left for Greece, taking with him their baby daughter. The incident becomes a “cause celebre” and eventually Cathy is given custody of her daughter, and a passport to travel to Greece. With the help of the Australian Consul in Athens she manages to get her daughter back from her husband’s family. Based on “Sun” journalist, Dick Wardley’s book, “A Piece of Paper”. Cast includes Michelle Fawdon, Bryan Brown and Frankie J. Holden.

results.title: The Job
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Michael Jenkins and Michael Carson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scales of Justice Series”.
The Job is a story of naivety. Probationary Constable Leonard Webber has the makings of a good policeman, but his ideals bring him into conflict with his colleagues. His lack of experience makes him vulnerable and his training has not prepared him for the system, how it works and the rationalisation of the double dealings. Rated: M

results.title: Dalmas
results.brief_description: Dalmas was a key work in independent cinema of its time, and it’s still a fascinating cinema experience. Made on a collective basis mainly with members of the communal artistic performing group, The Tribe. Heavily influenced by hallucinations and the philosophy of the time, the film also impresses with its formal innovation.

results.title: The Numbers
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Michael Carson and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scales of Justice Series”.
The Numbers is a story of ambitious and cunning manipulation. Glen Ferris is an astute young politician. At 41 he is already Attorney General, but his revolutionary reforms have weakened his standing in the Senior Cabinet. He needs the numbers, so he decides to use his controversial bill to take on vice-king Artie Roach, a move which makes him a crusader in the public eye while causing discussion in his own parliamentary wing. Rated: M
